boardgame.name: Encrypt
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face

You will participate in an official online board meeting of Newtown conglomeration about digital afterlife members' future. This game touches on the themes of profitability vs humanity, moral principles vs human weaknesses. Each player will be faced with difficult choices, hidden information, and manipulations and will need to express their opinion on some of the acute problems in the cyberpunk environment.

Tags: cyberpunk, digital afterlife, negotiations, personal secrets

boardgame.name: Exodiplomacy
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face, Edularp, Diplomacy Simulation

Alien diplomats representing each member civilization in the Interstellar Compact come together to debate Humanity’s application. Each diplomat has different priorities and a different way of communicating those priorities, using patterns of communication found in a variety of real world cultures.

Tags: Language, educational, diplomacy, sci-fi

boardgame.name: Face Front, True Believers!
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Letter Writing

An epistolary game about comics and fandom for 3–6 players. Players take on the role of a writer and a group of fans jockeying to put forward their interpretation of a comic book on the comic's letters page. For one reason or another, the writer has no idea what is in the book, and must rely on readers' questions and comments for clues.

Tags: Comics, Letters, Fandom, Authorship

boardgame.name: The Fake Out
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Tabletop/Pencil & Paper, Journaling

A tool for dealing with the grief of losing someone you care about.

Tags: Journaling, Playing Cards, Loss, Love

boardgame.name: The Fortunate Ones
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Chat/Message, Streaming/Online Face to Face

In 2066, AI and human scientists cracked the ability for humans to fully integrate their consciousness to Dotwun (what the Internet evolved into). Humans and fortunae experience differences in how they experience Dotwun, especially in sensory inputs. One player is a human, plugging in to Dotwun for the first time. The other is a fortuna, aiding the human in preparation for “transcending” to digital life in Dotwun. This game will involve the player of the human to interact with, touch, and sense objects in their real life physical environment, and describe it in detail to the other player. Only the player of the human will have a camera turned on, that both players will look at. Players will communicate through audio. The player of the AI will give instructions to the human player how to interact with the environment, based on a checklist of items that only that AI player will know. Players are likely to succeed, but will face challenges as the two characters will have gaps in communication and differences in how they perceive and sense things.

Tags: Transhumanism, neurodiversity, sensory, communication, empathy

boardgame.name: The Future of Sports
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face, sports

It is the future. Sports have evolved. No longer do our greatest athletes need to prove their might on the field with a full retinue of elite comrades. Now games can be decided from the comfort of our athlete's homes, available for everyone to see.

Tags: sports, goofy, contest

boardgame.name: Le Jeu du Centre Manche
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Centre Manche is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of the Center Manche region, country of Saint-Lô, Coutances, Torigni...

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Tholian Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadets, if a collar is added to the Neo-Tholian dreadnought, how do we identify the ship? No one knows except Cadet Granger? Very well, Cadet Granger.
If a Neo-Tholian dreadnought has a collar, then it is a Neo-Tholian heavy dreadnought.
Quite correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, study up on the collars by reading your copy of the Tholian Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The ninth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available.
It includes every Tholian and Neo-Tholian ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Tholian Holdfast. There is also information about the Tholians during the Early Years period when they first arrived in the Milky Way Galaxy.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher

Dad, what kind of starship is that?
Let’s get you the Federation Master Starship Book so you can look it up!

The first volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Federation ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Federation. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

boardgame.name: Slide in the DMs
boardgame.description:
Players rotate drawing a DM card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest Play card. Once everyone has played their chosen Play card to submit face down, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one.

Contains: 150 “DM” cards, 350 “Play” cards plus instructions

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Klingon Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadet, there’s a Klingon ship approaching. What is it?
Sir, it is a D7 battlecruiser. Arming phasers on your command!
Cadet, that is the Overlord, a D7N diplomatic cruiser. Diplomats take a dim view of having phasers pointed at them or their ships. After this simulation is over, you will return to your quarters and review the Klingon Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The third volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available. It includes every Klingon ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Klingon Empire. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles Silver Anniversary Master Rulebook

boardgame.name: Rus̄tiKo!!!
boardgame.description:
Rus̄tiKo!!! is a game inspired by RisiKo!, with an Abruzzo theme.

Your farm vehicles must conquer your opponent's territories (exactly like RisiKo!'s tanks).

Cards portray typical items from Abruzzo, such as arrosticini (sheep-meat skewers), trabocchi (fishing machines), olive trees, the warrior of Capestrano, and so on.

There are 43 territories.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Romulan Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadet, identify that Romulan ship which just uncloaked off our front shield!
Sir, that is a King Condor battleship. My copy of the Romulan Master Starship Book notes that it is conjectural. Should we try to escape to warn the Federation that it is not conjectural?
Well done, Cadet! Were this not a simulation, we would indeed do exactly that. However, since this is a simulation, let’s see if we can still carry out our mission.

The fourth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Romulan ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Romulan Star Empire. Romulans are especially challenging because of the history of the various great houses insisting on a particular design, the various stages of early versions of what would become the cloaking device, and the addition to their fleet of converted Klingon ships.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Star Fleet Battles Silver Anniversary Master Rulebook

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Lyran Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadets, how did the Lyrans produce their Lion dreadnought? Anyone beside Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger.
Sir, it involved cutting a Tiger-class heavy cruiser in half and installing a new center section.
As usual, Cadet Granger is correct. The rest of you, study your Lyran Master Starship Book. It isn’t a paperweight, you know.

The fifth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Lyran ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Lyran Star Empire. Lyrans are interesting because some ships were assigned to particular duchies. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Democratic Republic; those will be in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

boardgame.name: Go and Stop
고앤스탑
boardgame.description:
Agents scouting the computer city want to do a final system check before returning.

It detects the treasure signal, finds the error, and decides to come to the control room for debugging so that the system can operate normally.


How do you get your computer to work?


When we have the information we are curious about or want, the computer shows the results as we command them.
Computers do not do things based on their own judgment, but do things in order by human commands.
If the value of the path is wrong, it can be modified again.


The programmer gives the computer the correct command to do the job.



The computer (programmer) listens to the programmer's instructions and does the same.



Debugging corrects misuse or reprogramming.


<Purpose of the game>
1. Build teamwork and get 3 treasures quickly, starting with the enemy team.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board and place the treasure tiles in your pocket and mix well.
2. Team up in pairs and pick up a pen.

Two-player play: One player plays the program and the other plays the programmer role.
4 player: 2vs2 team member structure, one player in the team takes on the role of the program and the other is the programmer.


<Game play>
1. The player in charge of the program holds the pen in the starting position (pear) and closes his eyes.
The programmer takes the treasure out of his pocket and checks his location.
2. The programmer gives instructions, and the program follows the instructions and draws a path with a pen. You can command up to 3 times, and you can only shout direction and Go, Stop.
3. Put a clockwise direction in front of Go to tell the computer the direction.
ex) Direction (★ Hour) + Go + Stop
4. If the computer is hit by an island, whale, or shark while running, the programmer stops the command and clears the path.

Correcting errors due to errors is called debugging.


5. When you find a clue, you switch roles.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one team gets 3 clues, and the team that gets 3 first wins.

boardgame.name: Zebediah's Fishing Techniques and Equipment
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hello! It is I, The Great Zebediah, Master Magician! I am here to teach you about the wonders of fishing! I’ve been a fisherman for centuries, but never thought of writing down my fishing ventures until I realized that I haven’t shared my fishing knowledge with anyone yet and, well, I’m not getting any younger! Now I know the profession of fishing isn’t everyone’s cup of tea, but you would be surprised at the amount of ways we humanoids (and some non-humanoids) have hunted aquatic creatures that lie just under the surface of the water. In this supplement, I will show you that fishing can be a fun and adventurous encounter that can be MUCH more than just someone sitting at shore waiting for tension on the end of a string!

boardgame.name: Laeral Silverhand's Notebook - Surviving Icewind Dale
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I have held many titles in my time. Open Lord of Waterdeep, Lord Mage of Waterdeep, Chosen of Mystra and One of the Seven Sisters. But the most important name I hold for you is Laeral Silverhand, daughter of Mystra and Witch-Queen of the North.

When the Mother of All Magic called me to rule in the north, I was underprepared. Even after I managed to secure the kingdom Stornanter, there were still many dangers lurking around me, secrets hidden by an icy veil, horrors beyond what a mortal’s mind can grasp.

I hear you want to venture to the cold, unforgiving north; to uncover the secrets of the Icewind Dale and the Ten Towns. Most would think you foolish, mad and definitely unready. You cannot even wield the Spellfire, yet you still want to reach the Frozenfar. But fear not. If there is anything that could even remotely prepare you for the land you are about to set foot in, is I, the Queen of Stornanter.

boardgame.name: Pop Corn: Unplugged
팝콘
boardgame.description:
Agent 'Dogberg', preparing for a computer city reconnaissance, goes to the computer city, prepares popcorn to eat, and then contacts the routine. 'Dogbug' can't understand me. Let's help 'Dogbug' to help you understand the language.


How do computers represent information?


How can a computer know a person's language?
Computers use computer language to express data such as numbers and letters, or images such as photos and pictures.
1 on power on, 0 on power off, 1 for high dial tone, 0 for low dial tone. Like this, the computer can solve everything with two numbers, 0 and 1.

<Purpose of the game>
1. The sum of the numbers written on the popcorn must be greater than the other players.

<Game ready>
1. Save the information (popcorn) to your computer (pocket).
(Put the popcorn tiles in the pocket and shake to mix well.)
2. The cards are flipped over with the 0s visible and placed in ascending order from right to left.

<Game play>
1. The first player must take one less than the number of players from their pockets to fry them in the center of the table.
ex) If 4 players play, only 3 popcorn will be fried.
2. If it's fried in popcorn, flip the card over and make the number written on the popcorn first. Once you have made the number you see, you can shout "POP", then take the popcorn and place it in front of the card and wait a while.
3. If all the popcorn (information) is gone, make sure the popcorn you brought together and the binary card match. If it is right at this time, stack it next to it. If it is wrong, return the tile you brought, and return it from the number of tiles you have acquired.
4. When a new round begins, the player to the left in a clockwise direction starts the round with popcorn.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when there are no more popcorns to bounce, and a lot of people win by adding the number written to the total popcorn earned.

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: LDR Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Sir! Lyran ship approaching!
Load photon torpedoes. Fire all phasers!
End simulation. Congratulations, cadets. You just started a war with the Lyran Democratic Republic, a neutral power. Go study your LDR Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The sixth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Lyran Democratic Republic ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Lyran Democratic Republic. The LDR has very specific information because it was such a small empire. There are no Y-ships as the LDR didn’t exist in that timeframe. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Star Empire; those are in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Kzinti Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadets, how do we know the Kzintis considered building a battleship? Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
They attempted and failed to build the large warp engines it would require. Simulations showed that the proximity of the engines would require extra shielding and the engines would be more vulnerable to damage.
You are correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Kzinti Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The seventh volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Kzinti ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Kzinti Hegemony.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Gorn Master Starship Book
boardgame.description:
Cadets, why do the Gorns have so many of what we consider to be “hybrid ships” such as the destroyer-battlecruiser? Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
The Gorn legislature is notoriously stingy so the Gorn Admiralty plans ahead and finds ways to make larger ships from smaller ones.
You are correct as always, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Gorn Master Starship Books. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The eighth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Gorn ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Gorn Confederation.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles Silver Anniversary Master Rulebook

boardgame.name: Zip
집
boardgame.description:
'Jeep' checking the luggage of agents preparing to leave for computer city

Take a look at the size and weight of your luggage on the space board.
You are trying to pack it in the shape of a gear, but the luggage is too big to be packed.
Find the same pattern and reduce or compress it to pack a lot of capacity.


How to free up computer storage space?


If the amount of information is large compared to the limited storage space of the computer, the computer slows down and takes a long time to deliver.
In an efficient way, patterns can be simplified by coding when the same letter, number, etc. are repetitive.
Compression increases the storage space and speeds up the Internet.


Compression means removing empty spaces between data stored on your computer and coding it to simplify repetitive data.
Decompression means returning data to its original state.


<Purpose of the game>
1. The pile of tiles piled up by compression should be many and high.

<Game ready>
1. Arrange all the pattern tiles (data) in line with the board (computer capacity).
2. Each of them draws one mission tile (key keyword), checks it, and puts it face down so that it's hidden from opponents.

<Game play>
1. Select the pattern tile (data) you want to compress.
Ex: If there is more than one condition, information can be compressed. Shape, number, color, etc. It cannot be compressed diagonally.
2. A tile can only be moved once in a straight line in a horizontal or vertical direction if the conditions are met.
3. When compressing, you can compress by placing a pile on the tile, and you can compress by placing a tile on the pile.

<Game ends>
1. The game will end when compression is no longer possible.
The player with the most files on the mission card wins.

boardgame.name: Le Jeu du Cotentin
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Cotentin is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Cotentin.

boardgame.name: Arcadia Quest: Pets – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description: Foam tray with 28 compartments especially for Arcadia Quest: Pets. The 28 different compartments are perfect for the miniatures and cards in sleeves. The foam tray fits perfectly into the original board game box, or into the Feldherr box LBBG.

boardgame.name: Arcadia Quest: Riders – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
Each of your miniatures gets their own, exclusive compartment. This way, your minions, heroes, mounts and the Malkhor are throughly protected against damage. Delicate parts will thus stay intact, color will remain unharmed.

In order to make sure that nothing falls out of the tray or bumps against the lide of the game box, the set comes with a matching foam topper.

boardgame.name: Nemesis: Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
Your worst nightmare begins with the awakening. This thrilling sci-fi horror board game doesn't just convince with a dense atmosphere and clever gameplay. Above all the detailed alien miniatures make this game something very special.

And to keep the Xenos so impressive, here's the foam set for your Nemesis board game box.

The set fits exactly into the original 'Nemesis' board game box by Awaken Realms.

Provides space for all 26 miniatures and all accessories of the core game. Optional additional compartment for the Adrestia promo miniature.

The character boards, room tiles, the intruder board and the double-sided game board, the scanner, the intruder bag and the two booklets are placed on the foam topper.

The lid of the board game box protrudes approx. 5 cm.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Munchkin Dungeon: Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
For all Munchkin fans and followers the time of wishing and waiting has come to an end. With Munchkin Dungeon, the game now comes live, in 3D and in color to your tabletop. The principle remains the same, of course: Pick a hero, seek some trouble, defeat monsters, cheat your fellow players and grab the loot.

So that you can fully concentrate on your heroes and their upcoming adventures, here is the matching Feldherr foam set for the proper storage and protection of the miniatures and the game material.

boardgame.name: Munchkin Box of Holding: Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
As befits a CMON Kickstarter campaign, you get even more heroes and monsters in the dungeon and the Box of Holding thanks to the Stretch Goals.

Of course we have the matching Feldherr foam set for this box, too, so that these miniatures and accessories are also neatly and safely stowed away.

boardgame.name: Munchkin Dungeon: Side Quest – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
On this Feldherr foam tray, divided into 27 compartments, you can accommodate the heroes and monsters from the Side Quest Expansion and the Optional Buys. Whether it's Chthulhu, Medusa, a Halfling, or the Crawling Hand, there's a custom compartment for each of the miniatures.

Your miniatures are clearly arranged and sensitive parts are reliably protected against damage. You don't need to worry about painted figures either, because they are just as safe from scratches, abrasion and flaking paint.

boardgame.name: Enigma: Beyond Code – Additional Characters Promo
boardgame.description:
The Soul Devourer, Analyst, and Inspector are additional Characters you may include when playing Enigma: Beyond Code.

• The Inspector has been sent by the UK government to secretly investigate how the Agency works. His intention is to demonstrate that the Enigma Machine has no response to a person with a grain of Chaos. A lack of response will prove that the Agency is a gang of charlatans.

• The Analyst was born with a congenital disease depriving her of the ability to walk, but it allowed her to develop extraordinary analytical skills. She loves to solve puzzles of any kind and is ready to aid any specialist invited by the Agency, no matter what the cost is to her or the world.

• The Soul Devourer is an ethereal creature pretending to be a human. He strives to consume the mind of Dark Messiah or Decrypter to activate the Enigma code and return back to his homeworld.

Enigma: Beyond Code - Additional Characters is a promo mini-expansion packed in a zip-bag separate from the base game. It is not normally available in retail.

boardgame.name: Blocky Mountains: Schneller Aufstieg / Zeittraining Promo
boardgame.description:
Promo-Card for Blocky Mountains, handed out by Noris Spiele at Spiel in Essen 2018.

One side has the track "Zeittraining" (German, "time training") with an exclusive route.

The other side contains the small expansion "Schneller Aufstieg" (German "fast ascent")

boardgame.name: Spectre & Vox
boardgame.description:
Set in the world of Spectre and Vox in 1893, this exciting 3D table-top adventure game combines lights, sound and interactive storytelling for you to solve your own immersive mystery.

Open up your wooden chest to uncover a perfect replica of a haunted house from deep within the Spectre & Vox archives. Once assembled, download the app and input your password to activate the case file and lose yourself in your own escape room adventure.

As the story unfolds through audio files, touchpoints and immersive soundscapes, explore the rooms and use the props.

Apply your best detective and puzzle-solving skills to plot your route through this epic thriller and finally solve the mystery.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Harry Potter: Catch the Snitch
boardgame.description: Harry Potter: Catch the Snitch is a card-driven game in which players use cards to choose actions each round and cards for their Quidditch players. Players use dice to resolve actions such as shooting at the goal or stealing the Quaffle.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: #2 - Creating empathy during your tabletop session w/Jeff Stormer

boardgame.name: Adder: Realtime Chase System
boardgame.description:
The Vurdes Aerial Combat Institute has emerged as the premier pilot training facility in the galaxy. In order to gain admission, you've passed written tests and aced your interviews, but one final hurdle lies in your path: Adder. Can you best your rivals in this game designed to test your wits and reflexes?

In this real-time game, 2-4 players chase each other by quickly placing cards on the table in order to move their ship and land it on the opponent's one.

Real time games exist in an unique realm with board games. This one will remind you a bit of Snake, except there are no apples to eat in order to grow longer. What you are trying to do is cover the front or the back of the opponents’ snake, moving your back-most card to the front time and again until you win or you lose. The target is determined by a coin flip, and if you land on the coin or collide into the wrong part of a snake, you lose. This is sure to be a chaotic sort of fun that comes with very few cards and only a single coin as a component (well, apart from the table…)


This is a reimplementation of 2018 9-card game Adder: Realtime Chase System, with more cards (18) that gets the game to 4 players and some new rules.

Released in the February 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.

listing.notes: New, unplayed

boardgame.name: Template: Energy Infused (3E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the marrow in their bones to their skin, the Energy Infused Hero or Villain is saturated in a powerful energy source. Struck by elemental rays, bathed in experimental liquids, surviving lethal encounters; rather than perishing from their exposure, Energy Infused characters have been empowered by it – making the energy part of themselves. Energy Infused heroes and villains live in bodies transformed, and take to their new gifts with surprising ease. This PDF contains everything you need to add this new template inspired from DC Comics Human Bomb and The Ray and Marvel Comics Wonder Man or Radioactive Man to your Superhero genre game store and local home Super-Powered by M&M games.

boardgame.name: Back to Reality
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What lies at the center of the Pinicon Belt?

This adventure presents a crew of player characters with a profound ethical dilemma that could have sweeping ramifications that extend far beyond their own universe.

When the player characters investigate a dangerous asteroid field, they are confronted with doppelgangers from a different quantum reality where the Borg reign supreme. Can the player characters resolve tensions with their counterparts and solve the mysteries within an abandoned space station at the center of the asteroid field?

This standalone 17-page PDF adventure by Fred Love is for the Star Trek Adventures Roleplaying Game and is set during The Next Generation era. This adventure also contains advice for adaptation for use in campaigns based in other Star Trek eras.

boardgame.name: Demockrasy
boardgame.description:
Demockrasy is a two to eight player game in which you play the role of a powerbroker behind the scenes of American politics, putting together Politicians with Supporters whose votes they wield. Players compete to gain Power over the course of the game by voting on legislation their supporters approve or oppose; at the end of the game, the player with the most Power is the winner.

Demockrasy is played over four rounds. Each round has a Drafting phase, when you choose Politicians and Supporters, and a Legislation phase, when you sponsor and vote on Legislation.

During the Drafting phase, players pass several hands of cards around the table, each hand containing Politicians and Supporters. Players pick one of the cards from their hand, play it face-up in front of them, and pass the hand to the next player (passing left or right, depending on which round it is). There are three types of cards: Politicians, which may carry one to five supporters; Supporters, which give their associated politician one, two, or three votes; and Wild cards, which give the player a one-time opportunity to affect a legislative outcome or attack an opposing politician. Once all players have played five cards, the Legislation phase begins.

During the Legislation phase, each player must sponsor one Bill from their hand of Legislation cards (each player receives four Legislation cards at the beginning of the game). The player with the top-ranked politician sponsors the first Bill. Once the Bill has been revealed, all players must cast a vote to OPPOSE or APPROVE the bill on behalf of all of their supporters and politicians. Each player votes the total number of votes provided by their supporters. A simple majority wins; in a tie, the Bill fails.

Supporters may (a) APPROVE a Bill, (b) OPPOSE a Bill, or (c) neither. If a Politician betrays a Supporter--for example, by voting to APPROVE a Bill that's opposed by his or her supporters--then that Supporter will abandon its Politician and break one of that Politician's hearts. Each politician has 1 to 5 hearts; when the last heart breaks, the Politician retires and the associated supporters are discarded. Players also receive a broken heart--which they can assign to a politician of their choice--when they are on the losing side of a vote.

There are three ways to gain power: (1) if you sponsor a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (2) if you APPROVE a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (3) you get 1 Power for each Legislation result that aligns to your Supporters' interests.

After each round, clean up the spent Legislation cards and deal new Demockrasy cards (Politicians, Supporters, and Wild cards) to build up your political staff again! After four rounds, count up the power gained by each player; the most powerful player is the winner!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aegis of Empires GM's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Awaits in the Lost Lands!

The Aegis of Empires GM's Guide is here, with guidance for linking the adventures of the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path with the richly detailed history and culture of the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. You'll find two separate suggested series of linking adventures and supplemental material, one featuring adventures from Legendary Games and a second adventures from Frog God Games/Necromancer Games.

boardgame.name: Hey, What's That Planet?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a simple random planet generator for table-top games. Use it to quickly generate planets, or to stimulate your imagination by creating unique and interesting combinations for locations in your games.

boardgame.name: Spook Manor
boardgame.description:
It’s been fifty years since Startleton was terrorized by monsters in motor carriages. They were never to be seen or heard of again, and so with time the monsters become nothing but a part of old folks tales and scary campfire stories.

Since then, Spook Manor has sat empty and fallen into disrepair. Recently, a local group of children decided to prove that “there are no such things as monsters ”and so they gathered up the courage to go on an adventure and explore the manor.
You overheard that a group of brave kids are planning to stay the night here soon—this is the perfect opportunity to restore Spook Manor to its former terrifying glory and show them just how wrong they are!

Over the course of the game, you will draft and place twenty Room cards in an effort to restore Spook Manor. Different kids have different fears, and scaring them properly will award more points. In addition to rebuilding the manor and scaring the kids, you’ll also want to invite lots of monsters! Spook Manor was once famous among monsters as a party house. Monsters are terrifying, sure, but they also need something to do, so make sure you’ve got plenty of entertainment lined up for them to get down to. The player who has the best plan (most VP) to restore Spook Manor at the end of the game, wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Zepzeg Cycle
boardgame.description:
From publisher's web site:
The Zepzeg Cycle, you are brought to Yuggoth’s moon Thog, where you learn of the existence of the Zepzeg – a spacefaring alien species in many ways the antithesis of the Mi-Go. Plus, you learn of a lost colony of gnorri here so far from your world. Can you reconcile the Zepzeg, the Gnorri, and your own goals? Negotiate with an antediluvian entity of enormous psychic power, assist the Gnorri and the Zepzeg to forge alliances to help you in the difficult strife ahead, and find the awesome grimoire detailing a weapon of unthinkable might.

boardgame.name: Sprinkle
このみしぐれ (This Mischief)
boardgame.description:
Sprinkle — a.k.a., このみしぐれ (pronounced "Konomishigure") is an area-control game from Japan themed on "forest creation". The Japanese title could be translated to mean "sprinkle of fruits and nuts", which is what you hear falling from trees in autumn.

You each take on the role of a different tree species and use three different actions — grow trees, move flying squirrels (to spread the seeds), and move the clouds (to sprinkle water) — to gain victory points in the photosynthesis phase, which takes place several times during the game. The victory points you gain depend not only on the number and size of the trees, but also on the weather in the area where the trees grow.

You can also plant trees in each area to gain the "evolutionary power" of that area. By using such power effectively, you can achieve more, such as increasing growth efficiency and generating more victory points.

•••

『このみしぐれ』は、「森林の形成」をテーマにしたエリアコントロールゲームです。
各プレイヤーは、それぞれ異なる《樹木》の種族となって、①樹木の成長、②ムササビの移動（種の散布）、③雲の移動（水の散布）の3つのアクションを使い分けながら、ゲーム中に何度か訪れる《光合成》フェイズで、より多くの勝利点を得ることを目指します。
プレイヤーたちが得られる勝利点は、樹木の数や大きさだけでなく、その樹木が生育する地域（区画）の《天気》によっても左右されます。
また、プレイヤーたちは、各地域にいくつかの樹木を置くことで、その地域特有の《進化能力》を獲得できます。
進化能力を活用することで、成長の効率を高めたり、より多くの勝利点を生み出すことができるようになるでしょう。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Spider-Man 2: The Sinister Six
boardgame.description:
Spider-Man 2: The Sinister Six (or Spider-Man 2: Enter the Sinister Six in Europe) is a platformer video game for the Game Boy Color developed by Torus Games, published by Activision, and released on May 30, 2001. It is an alternative sequel to Neversoft's 2000 Spider-Man game on the main consoles, and mostly follows the events of the Game Boy Color version of that game. Though it has a similar format, it is not related to the 1992 NES game, Spider-Man: Return of the Sinister Six.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_2%3A_The_Sinister_Six Spider-Man 2: The Sinister Six]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition

boardgame.name: Halloween
boardgame.description:
[from the back of the book]
The dead are rising, hellish creatures roam the night, it's October 31st and not everyone has to dress up to scare others. In three adventures, the spirit of Halloween is brought to the gaming table for investigators of different ages:

Halloween in Dunwich
Who can save their family members from an ancient witch? Lovecraft County, six pre-made investigators, ages 11 to 13.

School of the Dead
A Halloween party in an elite boarding school leads some detainees straight to hell. Set in the present, with rules for the quick creation of stereotypical youth.

Trick or Treat
A murderous scarecrow isn't the investigators' biggest problem tonight. Set in the 1980s, with six pre-made adult investigators.

"And what am I supposed to do now? What should I do? "" Try to survive. "

boardgame.name: Expeditionen
boardgame.description:
[from the back of the book]
Greenland, Belgian Congo, New Guinea, the Caribbean and the Arctic - all of these are scenes of incredible horrors with which the investigators are confronted when treading the path into the unknown. One of the most classic CTHULHU themes returns to the gaming table with five adventures!

Eternal Ice (Ewiges Eis), Heart of Darkness (Herz der Finsternis) and The Last Rest of Minna B. (Die letzte Ruhe der Minna B.) are being re-published here for the first time since 2006, while Polaris and The Curse of the Golden Bracelet (Der Fluch des goldenen Armbands) have been written for this book.
A source section with new rules for your own creation and execution of expeditions invites game masters to be creative and encourage the joy of discovery in their gaming rounds.

boardgame.name: Grenzland
boardgame.description:
[from the back of the book]
This new adventure campaign is set in 1927 from Berlin via Breslau and Danzig to East Prussia. As escaped test subjects for blasphemous human experiments, the investigators turn the tables and the hunted become hunters. While their bodies and souls slowly transform into something strange, the trail leads east ... to the borderland.

They will meet unscrupulous business people, cold-blooded professional criminals, reactionary officers and mad medical doctors. They have to fight back against mutated humans and cruel Mythos creatures. In the struggle for their own humanity, they are confronted with the fate of Königsberg. Can they destroy the new governor of the Black Goat or do they have to see the end of the world?
Grenzland leads the players in six varied and closely interlinked episodes into an area that will be the scene of cthuloid horrors for the first time: East Prussia!

boardgame.name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia
Das Streben nach Glück: Nostalgie
boardgame.description:
From time to time, we all seek refuge in fond memories from our past; reminiscing about warm, cozy places where we once felt safe, blissful moments when everything seemed possible, significant others that made us feel important, made us feel loved... All these nostalgic reflections trigger a bittersweet, fuzzy emotion that gives a different perspective to our never-ending pursuit of happiness..!

The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia expansion introduces the concept of reminiscences; fond childhood memories, unfulfilled desires, dreams and aspirations of the past that players long to revive and pursue... Reminiscence deck features double-sided cards that, once their requirements are met, unlock unique card types and game-play options to the players. Dealt from the very beginning of the game, these cards will drive players' game choices as they genuinely promote planning ahead. Is it ever really too late to chase your deepest dreams and desires? The expansion also enriches existing card types (Projects, Items, Activities, Jobs, Partners, Life Goals and Child Traits) in order to guarantee a true “blast from the past” experience!

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box

boardgame.name: Fantastic Battles
boardgame.description:
Fantastic Battles is a fast-play, mass-battle, table-top wargaming system for any fantasy setting. The rules emphasise the tactical concerns of command friction and the fog of war through randomised initiative, tabletop mishap rolls and the impetuous decisions of unsupervised unit commanders.

An all-in-one volume, this book contains the rules for stand-alone pitched battles as well as campaigns.

Twenty-four example army lists are provided; however, army building is designed to be flexible. A toolkit of base profiles and unit traits allow players to build customised armies to suit their own vision of their fantasy faction.

Scale agnostic, with multi-based figures and no individual figure removal, the game can be played using any fantasy figures, or historical armies from the ancient to the early modern period.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Irregular Wars: Conflict at the World's End – A Wargaming System for Small Actions in the Age of Discovery

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Color of Madness
boardgame.description: The Color of Madness adds a new game mode, which offers a different experience, outside of the campaign mode. The sort of expansion that you can take out with friends for a challenging and fun game that will be played in about 90 minutes. You still need the core box in order to be able to play The Color of Madness.

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Weald
boardgame.description: The Weald expansion brings two heroes and completes the roster that can be found in the videogame, and of course the board game adaptation.

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Warrens
boardgame.description:
The Warrens are a unique location, as here you will find something that no other location has. As you explore around the aqueducts, you will see that some of the areas have unique abilities that others don’t. If you stay long enough in these areas, then it is certain that you will get a disease.. A visit to the Sanitarium will be mandatory after you leave the dungeon.

Two new Heroes will arrive at the Hamlet with this new expansion, the Leper and the Antiquarian.

The Swinefolk are the unique enemies you will encounter only in the Warrens location. They are all beasts or human beasts, and their deformities give them high resistances, especially to blight. This expansion gives you 26 new monsters (7 unique monster sculpts and 3 Bosses). For a total of 28 miniatures including the Heroes (not including potential Stretch Goals).

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Cove
boardgame.description: Prepare yourselves to explore the water-filled nightmares of the Cove. The mysteries of the deep seek to be explored - and revealed. The location where the Ancestor performed his pacts with the water beings - the ancient fishermen, will bring you nightmares.

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Crimson Court
boardgame.description:
This box adds a new location to the Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game, the Courtyard. The once green and lush gardens of the estate have fallen to decay. Now all you can see is the faintglow of the bloodlight, and a once lavish green place now infested with bloody insect-borne threats... and their unsuspecting victims.

The Crimson Court expansion introduces several new monsters in the game, the insect-like infestation that plagues the estate. In specific, you will get 8 new monsters, spanning from level 1 to level 3, and 4 new Bosses.

This expansion also comes with new Quest cards and new Curio cards, further expanding the Darkest Dungeon: the Board Game replayability. If there are two threats that your party of Heroes should be wary of in this location, is the constant stress and the high chances for bleed and blight.

The Crimson Court comes with 6 new room tiles. These are double-sided tiles, adding 12 new rooms in total that you can explore, making the dungeons even more dangerous and deadly. 12 new room cards are also added in your stash

boardgame.name: Belly of the Black Whale
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path continues! Having been betrayed by their confidants and stripped of their badges, the Edgewatch agents must perform a daring prison break to spring the wrongly incarcerated primarch. Old enemies become new friends as the heroes work for an infamous underworld crime lord in order to prove their fealty and receive blueprints to the enchanted prison galley known as the Black Whale. Once they've rescued their key ally, the heroes must find a way to clear their sullied names and, in the process, exact justice upon the treacherous business mogul who betrayed them in the first place.

"Belly of the Black Whale" is a Pathfinder adventure for four 15th-level characters. This adventure continues the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path, a six-part monthly campaign in which players take on the role of city watchdogs and dole out justice to Absalom's most nefarious criminal elements. This volume also includes new rules and exciting lore regarding Absalom's notorious prisons, the slithering snake goddess Ravithra, and a throng of new monsters and villains for urban fantasy campaigns.

boardgame.name: Stories
boardgame.description:
Stories is a family-friendly game that is designed for 2-6 players, takes about 30 minutes per game, and ages 8 and older keep things flowing the smoothest. Be the first to assemble your stories into a winning combination while building connection and trust along the way.

To begin, shuffle the cards and randomly deal 5 cards to each player. The first player draws one card from the deck. They give one card to a player of their choice and read the story prompt. That player gives them one card back and reads the story prompt. Two stories are shared on each turn. Get rid of the stories that don't help you while searching for the stories you need. Play proceeds to the next player until someone wins by having a winning combination of cards. A winning combination may only contain one Wild Card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tilt: An oracle for solo roleplaying
boardgame.description:
Tilt offers a different take on odds based oracles. Its aim is to help you generate obstacles that encourage problem solving using the resources available to you in your RPG of choice. This is achieved with a simple mechanic that answers Yes and No questions but has a twist of its own. You will find guidelines and examples on how best to achieve this type of play.

In addition to the oracle, included is an ideation process coined "Mincing Your Words" which uses your favorite works of fiction or non-fiction to help you generate narratives. My hope is that it will help your adventures feel more grounded in the types of works you love.

Note: Tilt itself is NOT a narrative oracle with lists of keywords or images to interpret. There are no random events. Its main mechanic relies on providing binary answers (yes or no) to closed questions.

Description taken from: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/319632/Tilt--An-oracle-...

See blog review here: https://www.ppmgames.co.uk/2020/11/23/mork-borg-conan-non-au...

See video review here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ELOsZvfiMww&;feature=emb_title

boardgame.name: Monsters of Murka: The Cryptid Chronicle Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ah, so you've found Doctor Biggus Footicus' journal, eh?

The second mini-expansion to the world of Monsters of Murka.

Protect or fight your way through unforgiving terrain, haunted locations and the lair of famous cryptids! Plus learn 7 new spells like the haunting Flesh Gate which allows you to transport via person.

This hilarious Halloween supplement features

15 Cryptids to intertwine into any creepy campaign
10 new magic items
7 new spells
4 new locations
A new Blood Hunter subclass inspired by the late great Eddie Van Halen

boardgame.name: Hallmarks of Romance
boardgame.description: In this game, the players portray characters in a romantic comedy. There will be a lead, a catalyst, a number of bit players, and maybe a heel or two. None of these characters is perfect and playing the game will expose their imperfections and, hopefully, let them find someone who can help them overcome their problems. During the course of the game, there will be several scenes which lead the characters to the conclusion. In this game, the conclusion is usually two people realizing they complete each other and falling in love.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Pets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hello and welcome to Marv’s Fabulous Magical Emporium, the universe’s foremost traveling bazaar for all things magical and full of wonderment. Today is your lucky day my friend, as I have many strange and wondrous creatures in stock that make excellent and entertaining pets for discerning adventurers such as yourself.

Dungeon Pets is a system-neutral Illustrated bestiary that includes a guild on how to convert these monstrous pets over to any game system. Each pet comes with some basic stats, a full description, and a listing of various traits such as abilities, habits, and ecology. Everything a Gamemaster and Player will need to bring these creatures to life in their game.

DUNGEON PETS IS AN RPG ZINE THAT INCLUDES:
• 23 unique Dungeon Pets.
• Rules to include Dungeon Pets into any game system.
• Examples of Dungeon Pets converted over to various game systems.
• Optional pet health system.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 247 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 247
September 2020

boardgame.name: Earthjumpers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

EARTHJUMPERS is a pamphlet micro-setting designed to be used with the Troika! RPG. In it, you play as a brave Earthjumper, humanity’s last chance at rebuilding Earth, after the devastating cataclysm that shattered it. Visit innumerable alternate versions of Earth, all of them with their own problems, in a race against time to complete your mission and return to your own earth. Will you fight the terrible Jawari, sabotage their unfathomable plans, and gather all the crystallized alternomium to heal your version of Earth? Or will you simply disappear with a loud “pop”, nobody even remembering you existed in the first place?

Within this pamphlet you'll find:

A brief setting description
A new Background for Troika!: the brave but doomed Earthjumper
A table of reasons why your Earthjumper squad would be sent to a parallel Earth
10 possible alternate Earths
The terrible Jawari. Did anyone say space llamas?
Possible mission complications

boardgame.name: Pathfinder 2 Roleplaying Game: Beginner Box
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take the first step into an amazing world of fantasy adventure! The Pathfinder Beginner Box contains everything you need to learn how to play the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, including rules to create your own fantasy hero and tools to make your own amazing stories.

Will you be a courageous fighter, charging headfirst into battle, or a sly rogue, moving quietly to strike at foes from the shadows? Maybe you will be a knowledgeable wizard, wielding incredible arcane spells or a wise and pious cleric, using the power of your deity to shape the world for the better. It is all up to you!

Inside you will find a rich toolbox, filled with everything you need to get started, including rules for character generation, an introductory adventure, guidelines to build your own campaign, character sheets, a full-color map, character pawns, and dice. This deluxe box set is the ideal introduction to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, leading the way to a lifetime of adventure!

The Pathfinder Beginner Box includes:


An 80-page Hero's Handbook, including rules for character generation, a solo adventure, skills, spells, and equipment.
A 96-page Game Master's Handbook, containing an introductory adventure, over 20 pages of monsters, rules for building your own adventure, and magic items.
Four premade characters so you can jump right into the action and four blank character sheets if you want to make your own hero.
Over 100 character and monster pawns to use on the full-color double-sided adventure map.
Four game reference cards to help players remember their actions.
A complete set of polyhedral dice, including a d20, d12, d10, d8, d6, and d4.

listing.notes:
Brand new, sealed in shrink.
Ships from Central Connecticut.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 248 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 248
October 2020

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 249 - Nov 2020)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 249
November 2020

boardgame.name: Egalicon
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Egalicon is to capture all pieces of one type from your opponent. Each player starts with twelve pieces on a 6x6 game board: four each of diamond, scissors, and paper, with diamond pieces able to capture scissors, scissors able to capture paper, and paper able to capture diamond.

On a turn, move one of your pieces, one of your towers, or only the top piece of one of your towers. You can move this piece or tower onto an adjacent space that:


is empty,
that has one of your own pieces or towers, or
that has an opposing piece or tower that you can capture.


When you move onto your own piece, those pieces form a tower; either player can look at the pieces within a tower prior to moving. Building towers allows for faster movement of multiple pieces on the game board at the risk of having multiple pieces removed at once, although you can split towers bit by bit by moving only the top piece on a turn.

When you capture an opposing piece or tower, you remove all of those captured pieces from the board. Capture all opposing pieces of one type to win.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition de Paris
boardgame.description:
How well do you know Paris?
This edition is a way to know.
The questions are very specific and you have to have a good knowledge of the city.

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she/he can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

boardgame.name: Family Quizz: Football
boardgame.description:
Family Quizz Foot is a trivia game about football: history, football techniques, supporters...


60 cards / 720 questions
6 difficulty levels
3 game modes
36 tokens
1 die


The winner is the first player to score 30 points

1961 is a Cold War card game where players take turns bolstering their nation, spying on enemies, and launching missiles. As tensions mount, the threat of nuclear war looms overhead, and players strive toward technological victory, world peace, or mutually assured destruction.

Players take turn drawing one card, playing one card, and activating any available buildings. There are three ways to play a card - as an Action (one-time use), as a Building (permanent, destructible resource), or as Supply (face down on a building, acting defensively).

Launching missiles is the primary mechanic of the game. Players must take caution though, as each launch risks activating enemy counter missile known as Response Systems.

1) Win the Space Race by stacking five cards on your Moon Lander.
2) Build 3 Embassies to achieve diplomatic world peace.
3) Be the sole survivor of a nuclear wipeout.

- Description from the Publisher

boardgame.name: Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame
boardgame.description:
Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame Snowball fight - entry-level wargame.

Schneeballschlacht - Snowball Fight is a simple tabletop wargame without a “war” and is therefore ideally suited for young wargamers to get their feet wet.

3-10 minis per player - 25-40mm

boardgame.name: Rise of the Metro
boardgame.description:
In Rise of the Metro, players compete to build subway lines. As more lines connect to a station, the station increases in value. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

To setup, the map is seeded with 12 initial stations. On a player's turn, they place one of their colored track pieces onto the map. The piece must follow the grid lines; must not establish a direct station-to-station connection that another line has previously made; and must not create a branch. Pieces are not obligated to be contiguous with previous plays, but if a player ends the game with multiple networks, one will be removed.

After track has been placed, the players look to see if any stations expand. Each station is worth a number of points equal to how many different lines have connected to it, and once a new line connects, additional wooden station tokens are stacked on top of previous ones.

Each players' score is equal to the value of the stations in their network.

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Pokémon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A fantasy role play Nuzlocke challenge for the Pokémon games based on 5th edition Dungeons & Dragons.

User summary:

Requires the use of 5th Ed core books. The product uses artwork with a claim of fair use via an online wiki - it is not clear whether this infringes on copyrighted intellectual property.

boardgame.name: Rocket Lairs & Dragonairs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Compatible Games: This ruleset can work with any main series Pokémon RPG game, but is most suited for Generation IV or later, after moves were given a damage category individually, rather than by type.

User summary:

Requires the use of d20-based Pokémon-capable RPG. The product uses artwork with a claim of fair use via an online wiki - it is not clear whether this infringes on copyrighted intellectual property.

boardgame.name: History of Quidditch
boardgame.description:
Quidditch is played by children on broomsticks in the back apple orchard, by teams of students at wizarding schools, and by professional athletes whose exploits are followed avidly al over the world. Amazing, right?

Well, now anyone (even Muggles!) can play Quidditch at home with History of Quidditch - The Miniatures Game, which is a card and miniatures game played by 2 or more opposing coaches that replicates the speed and danger of Quidditch on a pitch (board/mat) that plays in a little over an hour.

So grab a pint of butterbeer and shake hands with your opponent. Take a seat and meet your team. Get ready to experience Quidditch like never before!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fútbol Base
boardgame.description:
Fútbol Base is the board game with which you can experience football as a coach and a player at the same time.

Choose the Football 11 or Football 8 board for your games and design the best formation against your opponent.
Improve your technique and aim on the practise field and enjoy your evolution as a player.

With Football Base live all the passion of football without leaving home.

Rules:

Place the players with the formation of your choice (4-3-3 / 5-3-2 / 4-4-2, etc.).
Put the ball in play...
The side in possession of the ball is the one closest to the ball. (or whoever the referee says so)
A player can only have two consecutive touches of the ball. And the maximum number of touches of the ball per area is 4.
Shooting at goal is allowed only in the shooting area
When the player in possession prepares to pass or shoot, the defender can only move 1 player to try hinder her/him
The player formation can only be altered when the game is stopped (ball out of play)
If a player shoots and knocks down an opponent it is a foul; On a forward, a penalty is given.
Shooting or passing is only valid if hit with your hand on the player.
There can be three changes plus the goalkeeper.
Games last 40 minutes. Plus extra time or penalty shootout if needed.

boardgame.name: Dung: Unplugged
덩
boardgame.description:
Agents browse folders to find information.

Searching sequentially from problem 1, sometimes splitting into sections, sometimes using a hash table...
But... I don't see the dunk.


Computer Science Principles-Explore/Search


Computers store a lot of data. When it is necessary to find the information you want, it searches, but the computer outputs it according to various condition search methods. This requires command and judgment, and uses effective methods to quickly find data while classifying or selecting data. Alternatively, you can use search keys such as words, numbers, names, addresses, barcodes, and QR codes to let the computer find the information you are looking for.

<Purpose of the game>
1. Match the number of cards on your head strap and collect 3 cards.

<Game ready>
1. Each player tie a headband to his forehead.
2. Each player attaches 1 card to the headband. At this time, you should not know the contents of the card. Then take the recording paper.

<Game play>
1. You can ask questions once at a time.
Ex) card (17)
Question: Is it less than 20?
Answer: yes
2. The player who hears this answer writes.
Ex) card (17)
-The number of cards is less than "20". So my card is above the number "20".
3. Ask questions one by one, and when the correct answer comes up, place the card in front of you and insert a new card into your forehead.
4. If the answer is not correct, place the card without checking it and attach a new card to the headband without checking it yourself.

<Game ends>
- If someone collects 3 cards, the game ends and that person wins.

boardgame.name: Sunken
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sunken is an RPG of nautical horror based on the Trophy system. The stories we tell are often not of gallant survivors but of the hard-pressed, star-crossed crestfallen. They are the poetry of the broken and the inhuman breakers: haunting things, deep and dark and bellowing things, unfathomable things that consume all that edges to their precipice.Sunken is a tabletop roleplaying game about these things. It is a tabletop roleplaying game about these things and the sea. It is a tabletop roleplaying game about how your characters find their doom among these things while at sea. Sunken shifts the focus of the world of Trophy onto – and below – the vast and treacherous Salt Sea, expanding "That Silent Howl" from Codex: Void into a full stand alone system that remains rooted in the mechanics of Trophy Dark.

boardgame.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description: Complete set with 43 compartments for all figures, cards in sleeves, tokens and map tiles from the original Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia - Core Box. The set fits: the monster dice, cards in sleeves, small and medium dungeon tiles, the heroes and all tokens. The foam trays fits perfectly into the original board game box, or into the Feldherr box LBBG. In addition, the set also offers a free compartment for a hero, e.g. Luke the Lucky and 15 free compartments for monster dice.

boardgame.name: Trek 12: At Home – Semaine 1
boardgame.description:
Trek 12: At Home is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in November 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in three game modes: "À l'intérieur: multi" (multi), "À l'intérieur vs JiMINy" (solo) and "Cookie Challenge" (solo or multi).

boardgame.name: Dark Story
Expediente Dark
Unfold: Dark Story
Доктор Дарк
boardgame.description:
Only a couple of days ago you were the head psychiatrist at a mental health clinic but everything changed overnight when one of your experiments went south and several patients escaped your clinic placing your experiments in jeopardy. You had to take flight, but you didn’t make it far: you were detained by the police and delivered to the police station. Now you need to find a way out before they lock you up for good.

Dark Story is a sequel to Escape from the Asylum and a thrilling co-operative adventure that fits into a small envelope. You can delve into the mysterious atmosphere of this tabletop quest regardless of whether or not you are familiar with the story of Dr.Dark’s clinic. The players must help Dr. Dark get out of his prison cell at a police station by solving different puzzles. Can you make a daring escape?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão
boardgame.description:
The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão, players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão: Escândalos

boardgame.name: Van Gogh
boardgame.description:
Van Gogh is a game in which we are the inspirations inside the artist's mind, the minigoghs (meeples), beings with different personalities and special skills: happy, dreamy, impatient, melancholic and playful minigoghs.

The meeples rolling mechanism reflects van gogh's untimely, fickle and creative personality, combined minigoghs can be allocated by their positions: lying, on its sides, standing or upside down.

Our goal will be to use the minigoghs in the most efficient way to paint the works, scoring points of prestige.
In the round, players take turns selecting a character card from those on the table receiving a full bonus. After this, every player to receive the simple bonus of the character.

Each space allocation is scored immediately and the winner will be the one who collaborates most efficiently with the paintings at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: War of the Realms
boardgame.description:
War of the Realms is an asymmetric, tactical card game for two players that embraces RTS and TBS games from the past with nostalgic pixel art!

In the game, cards can be played by discarding required number of other cards from hand. Units can be sent to attack enemy realm or defend the player's own realm. The player can also build structures, play events or play upgrade cards. The player can also upgrade their realm, if required cards for next level are in play.

The combat is resolved with dice rolls. After dice result and modifiers are added, the result is compared to an enemy’s armor values. Then the corresponding damage is inflicted.

The game ends if a player destroys an opponent's realm. Alternatively, the game can be won if a realm is upgraded to level 3.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Akkadian Rhythms: Player Handout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world as you know it has been warped and twisted. The Greeks never rose, the Romans never conquered. Ancient magic and mysterious forces rule the world, giving the Akkadian empire the fertile soil to stand strong through time. As time crawls forward, more wonderous powers are released with every passing epoch. The thirst for magic of the people unleashes strange and wonderous sights onto the world.

Now the world has reached a dark age. The Akkadian realm becomes weak to the spirit plane. The dead escape the nether. The deities of ancient legend stay locked in their heavens. Mysterious forces gain a life of their own and reign over the people. It is a time for adventure.

Join into the world of Akkadian Rhythms. This Player Handout will walk you through character creation, begin their epic poem, and guide players on how to interact with the game world through characters.

boardgame.name: Akkadian Rhythms: Setting Handout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world as you know it has been warped and twisted. The Greeks never rose, the Romans never conquered. Ancient magic and mysterious forces rule the world, giving the Akkadian empire the fertile soil to stand strong through time. As time crawls forward, more wonderous powers are released with every passing epoch. The thirst for magic of the people unleashes strange and wonderous sights onto the world.

Now the world has reached a dark age. The Akkadian realm becomes weak to the spirit plane. The dead escape the nether. The deities of ancient legend stay locked in their heavens. Mysterious forces gain a life of their own and reign over the people. It is a time for adventure.

Learn about the strange history that has shaped the world of Akkadian Rhythms in the Setting Handout. Epochs, ancient legends, and each plane of reality form an alternative fantasy setting that combines a long lost empire with a time of magic and conquest. This guide contains the information needed to flavor your own campaigns with the history and culture of Akkadian Rhythms.

boardgame.name: Akkadian Rhythms: Skills Handout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world as you know it has been warped and twisted. The Greeks never rose, the Romans never conquered. Ancient magic and mysterious forces rule the world, giving the Akkadian empire the fertile soil to stand strong through time. As time crawls forward, more wonderous powers are released with every passing epoch. The thirst for magic of the people unleashes strange and wonderous sights onto the world.

Now the world has reached a dark age. The Akkadian realm becomes weak to the spirit plane. The dead escape the nether. The deities of ancient legend stay locked in their heavens. Mysterious forces gain a life of their own and reign over the people. It is a time for adventure.

Become a unique character with traits and skills that tell stories of high adventure. The Skills Handout for Akkadian Rhythms outlines the many skills that players may choose from when creating their character and provides insight on how to best use them to tell a shared narrative.

boardgame.name: Akkadian Rhythms: Combat & Equipment
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world as you know it has been warped and twisted. The Greeks never rose, the Romans never conquered. Ancient magic and mysterious forces rule the world, giving the Akkadian empire the fertile soil to stand strong through time. As time crawls forward, more wonderous powers are released with every passing epoch. The thirst for magic of the people unleashes strange and wonderous sights onto the world.

Now the world has reached a dark age. The Akkadian realm becomes weak to the spirit plane. The dead escape the nether. The deities of ancient legend stay locked in their heavens. Mysterious forces gain a life of their own and reign over the people. It is a time for adventure.

Battle through dangers that emerge in Akkadian Rhythms with the Combat & Equipment handout. This guide teaches players and Game Masters how to resolve combat, resolve skills, use equipment, and use mechanics to drive story together.

boardgame.name: Timeless: Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Movies are full of characters who see a monster and try their hardest to get killed at the hands of that beast. Mutant shark? Let's go swimming! Volcano monster? Let's collect geodes! These people were written into the story just to find a way to die.

But what if your only recourse wasn't screaming at the TV screen? What if YOU were that character. This is your chance in Creatures! Invent cures, order guards to their doom, and blow up half of the facility to stop that horror from reaching the general public. And do it all your own way. It's your chance to save the day in a game of Creatures! A supplement for Timeless the RPG.

boardgame.name: Mundane Magic: Fantasy Equipment Expansion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many kinds of RPGs out there to play. Some are high adventure games that similate a battle down to the finest detail and others are fanciful walks through the unrestricted imagination of the player. Still some find a delightful medium between the two. That is where Mundane Magic fits in. A bit of structure in the webs of story woven by Timeless the RPG.

When used as a companion material to the Basic Manual, this book of fantasy equipment fills in the details needed to run a fantasy themed game. The inspiration for the history of the campaign world can work with this book as a tool for filling the game with equipment to match the genre.

Mundane Magic expands upon the suggested list of fantasy weapons and armor in the Basic Manual to fit more types of equipment encountered during gameplay. It also provides a list of magical items that players can use to further explore the campaign world. The ease of introducing objects on the fly in Timeless the RPG, combined with this list of magical items, will fuel the imagination to quickly add new content to any fantasy themed game.

boardgame.name: Monster Slaughter: Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
This game has everything lovers of the classic 80s horror movie could wish for. A cabin in the woods, partying students, monsters, blood and lots of screaming. Choose a monster family and enjoy your student meal.

Besides the entertaining setting and story, Monster Slaughter convinces above all with loving artwork and lots of great miniatures. In order to save you the horror of broken figure parts or lost tokens, we have the right foam set for you here.

boardgame.name: Doom Machine
boardgame.description:
Doom Machine is an intense pressure-cooker card and dice mint tin solo game experience that fits in your pocket. Face off against an ever-evolving, ever-growing machine of death and destruction! Find and defeat the doom core before humanity is annihilated.
Beware: the machine evolves, grows, and cycles each of its parts every turn. You must roll your dice with care, use abilities to modify the results as necessary, allocate dice to deal or block damage, and strategically destroy parts of the DOOM MACHINE to prevent your demise!

Each turn consists of two phases:

In Phase I, you'll roll your unlocked dice, using the limited available utility slots to modify or re-roll, then allocate dice to either shields (to block incoming damage) or to machine part cards in play (if the roll criteria is met) to deal damage to a part. Destroying parts earns you additional dice for future rolls.

In Phase II: The machine AI takes action, cycling the tracking die on each of its available machine part cards and triggering abilities when the die reaches an icon on its AI track -- potentially dealing damage, repairing, locking die, and impacting gameplay in other nefarious ways.

When all of the machine parts have completed their cycle, the entire line shifts down one slot and a new machine part is added to the doom machine line, increasing the difficulty with each turn.

Can you keep the machine at bay long enough to destroy the core and win?

—description from the designer
